38912207.review: He llorado y he reído como un niño con la obra de Laura Shigihara , pero sobre todo he reflexionado sobre los temas duros y chocantes que toca. Rakuen es un juego dividido en dos mundos, uno real y otro de fantasía, donde los protagonistas tienen sus versiones en ambos mundos, mientras vemos la crudeza en el mundo real y su complejidad, vemos la simplicidad y la parte bonita en el mundo "abstracto" de Rakuen. 38894586.review:
I bought Rakuen in hopes that it will deliver the same emotional impact that To the Moon did - what I ended up getting is a beautiful and captivating story which for me makes up for a slightly less impactful yet still emotional ending.

The utilization of RPG Maker is really the only setback I could think of with this game since actual gameplay is limited to "fetch quests" and movement of your character is very rigid. That is to say however that this game's ~7-hour story and world-building is something that is definitely worth experiencing. The characters are likeable in their own right, and many of them have their own stories attached to them that portrays a related, valuable message.

Some of the gameplay elements are inconsistent in some ways. For example, in getting tasked to obtain two quest items, one of them took 20 minutes to get while the other just required less than 5 minutes. Although this is just something minor, I feel like this could be improved upon given the significance the items have to the drive of the story.

The world-building, to expound, is really nice with colorful and creative design. The music was great as well, especially given the fact that this is produced by RPG Maker. Some areas in the game act as a sort of obstacle in a sense that it requires a couple of seconds to uselessly circumvent passages that could be better of not being their in the first place. I guess it's part of making the world feel big and less forgettable - but I find it more of a hindrance honestly.

Overall, the story and the characters really are the driving force of this RPG, and does have the potential to make you shed some tears. I'd recommend it to fans of story rich games since it's somewhat inexpensive and can use up a good number of hours. 6/10

38886642.review: I loved it, it has a really good plot. There's many plot twists I just couldn't stop playing.

38885455.review:
Rakuen is primarily story-based, but it also lends itself to a fair bit of adventure in terms of gameplay. The world is imaginative, and characters are disarmingly unique in both art and personality. I especially love the graphics, which are so engaging it made me atttempt to interact with everything lying in my path (and I'm still irked that you can't move the wooden basins, they just look so interactable). The soundtrack is simplistic and incredibly atmospheric - and even if you don't play the game I'd say that the music by itself is totally worth the buy. That said, Rakuen isn't completely well-rounded. There's a fair bit of running around, and the puzzles are noticeably imbalanced in quantity as you progress, which made the gameplay feel rushed or dragged out in some places.

Still, in terms of story, Rakuen is a beautiful tale of acceptance. It's loaded with recurring themes and concepts that, from start to finish, subtly conveys the story to the player without explicitly revealing facts. For me, those moments of dawning realization (and tears) were the best parts of the game. If you're looking for a short but heartfelt experience, I'd say play Rakuen. There's nothing to lose (except your tears), and much to learn (or at least ponder) if you do.

38724058.review: Rakuen has one of the most heart-touching stories I have ever heard. The feels are strong with this one, but it has a humorous side to it as well. The characters are adorable and easy to get attached to. I hate hospitals, but this is the first time I’ve felt such warmth within the cold walls of a hospital. The characters felt like they were kind of like a family to each other. The soundtrack of this game is simply amazing. The game lacks combat and focuses on story-telling. The game offers some mini-quests as well. It does lack a sprint button which sometimes makes me impatient. But in my opinion, the lack of any sprinting only gives the game more realism since the protagonist IS “A hospitalized Boy” in the end. As you can see in the game description. So, I don’t think he should be running around anyway. I thank the developers for a making a great game. I feel that it’s under-appreciated. My final words about the game would be…10/10 would cry again.

38694953.review:
If you're preparing to dive into this game, have a box of tissues ready.

ugh my eyes hurt from all the crying

If you liked To the Moon, I'm sure you'll also love this game. 
The heartwrenching plot, the lovely and totally adorable characters, the cutesy quips, the intense (?) gameplay at certain moments, and a fantastic soundtrack; all of these mix to create the perfect recipe for an amazing, amazing game.

Yes, this game does have flaws, but most (if not all) are introduced by the RPGMaker engine. More specifically, the clunky movement (please, santa, let me walk faster and move dianogally, that's all I want for christmas). As a result, it makes the occasional backtracking a lil bit more annoying than normal.

However, the good absolutely outweights the bad. You'll probably be too engrossed in everything else to notice the shortcomings. Please treat yourself to this game if you have the chance. The reviews are "Overwhelmingly Positive" for a reason, afterall.

I cried, a couple times. I admired Laura Shigihara's contributions to [i]To The Moon[/i] and subsequent games, but I definitely enjoyed the different direction this took. 38615654.review: This game brings me surprise and joy every moment. This is obviously a story driven game with some light puzzles. Some of the light-hearted dialogue and animation are funny and joyful.The tone and puzzle mechanic keeps on changing, so it didn't feel like I'm dwelling in the same mood or gameplay for too long; it makes everything a fresh experience. The chapters are neatly tighted together in the story, so it doesn't feel like just one quest after another, but instead more like a story as a whole. This allows the players to complete sink into that "magic circle", the zone where our mind is in the game, instead of waking up and realize "oh yeah I almost forgot that this is a game." The art style tied neatly together so well; simply beautiful and joyful. The characters are charming. The story is heart waming. I can see the story is tighted to the event in our reality, but even when facing the harsh reality, this game shows that the humanity is still there. All in all, I'm very happy that I get to play this game. The best experience I had in such a long time. Hugh thanks to the developer and art team for creating such a master piece. I hope more people get to play this.

38383594.review: Okay, so first and foremost, I'd like to say that I've only spent about 2 and a hlf hours in this game. I have not finisheed it, nore have I even come close to doing so. But holy shit. This game is amazing. Every scene feels like a painted picture, the character interactions are charming and lighthearted, the themes are very real and will tug at your heart strings, and the music elicits a full range of emotions that I can't explain in one simple review. I had been following this game's development through Laura Shigihara's youtube channel because I was a fan of to the moon and other games she had composed for. After what felt like an eternity of waiting, the game finally came out. Then I waited to get money to buy the game. But, in the end, all that waiting was worth it. The joy I feel when playing this game is incomparable. I fully understand that saying all this when I've barely nibbled at the meat of the story is probably unwise, but I don't care. The game has me this enchanted that I'm throwing logic out the window and thinking with my heart. To put it simply, this game is amazing. 10/10 from me.

38381846.review:
相当不错的游戏。
总体来说，就是癌症少年的老妈，在儿子本该是生命最痛苦的最终阶段，给他编造了一个童话世界。让他以勇者的身份，去帮助同处于病痛中的病人。于是儿子一扫病魔侵扰的阴霾，在假想的童话世界中，逐渐去了解其他人的处境，并给他们带来了温暖和慰藉。最后也放下心中对父亲忙于抗灾无暇探视的怨恨，安详地离去了......
是个表面很欢乐，实则很悲伤无奈的故事。

而另一个值得注意的是游戏的伏笔。
一开始我以为老妈帮主角做了个中二的勇士帽子，只是为了增加儿子在游戏中的代入感。而随着剧情发展，我们才知道原来儿子患的是癌症，最后老妈第一次摘下帽子时，只见原来浓密充裕的秀发，早已只剩了一个光亮的脑壳，那一刻心头真的是五味杂陈。

还有爱收集弹珠，并给每颗弹珠都精心编造一个奇妙世界的小女孩。由于家庭的冷漠，造就她沉迷幻想不善交际的性格，因此遭受到同龄人的不解和霸凌，也正因此，她才救下了一条被抓住的流浪狗，并与之结下了深刻的羁绊。

诸如此类，不胜枚举。

然而，在十小时左右的游戏时长中，强行塞入五个故事，还要给他们埋线布局，同时还要抽调资源给童话世界。这让故事显得有些仓促，失去节奏。

像最后救儿子那一段，就明显有赶工的痕迹，连谜题都没剩下几个了。

不过，这也是可以理解，毕竟主创是搞音乐的。本作的音乐风格真的是非常多样，从恐怖到乡村轻快再到宫廷庄贵再到真人献唱。而且旋律也非常动听。值得单独入ost。

This game is worth more than it costs.

38377420.review:
อีกหนึ่งเกมดีสำหรับเกมเมอร์สายเนื้อเรื่องที่คล่องอังกฤษพอประมาณ 

Rakuen เกมสไตล์เดียวกับ To The Moon แต่ยาวกว่าประมาณเท่าตัว

Rakuen เป็นเรื่องราวเกี่ยวกับดินแดนมหัศจรรย์ที่ต้องได้รับการยินยอมจาก Morimoza เทพแห่งป่า เท่านั้นถึงจะนั่งเรือไปยังดินแดนนั้นได้

เรื่องราวโฟกัสไปที่เด็กน้อยผู้สวมหมวกกระดาษพับทรงนักรบซามูไรญี่ปุ่น ที่นอนป่วยอยู่ในโรงพยาบาลแห่งหนึ่ง

และ หนังสือเล่มหนึ่ง ซึ่งเป็นนิทานที่ชื่อว่า Rakuen เป็นหนังสือที่เกี่ยวกับเรื่องที่กล่าวไปเบื่้องต้น และแม่ของเด็กคนนี้มักจะอ่านให้ฟังก่อนนอนประจำ

วันหนึ่งหนังสือได้หายไป เด็กน้อยจึงออกตามหา และได้พบกับประตูสู่โลกอีกใบอันแสนมหัศจรรย์ 

เด็กน้อยค่อยๆไขปริศนาเบื้องหลังประตูอีกบาน และช่วยเหลือผู้คนในโลกเหล่านั้นคลี่คลายปมและแก้ไขปัญหาไปทีละนิด

จนกระทั่งถึงจุดไคลแม็กซ์ของเรื่อง ที่เรื่องราวกลับเฉลยทุกสิ่งให้คุณรู้ว่าที่เราเล่นผ่านมานั้น ไม่ใช่เป็นแค่ดินแดนวิเศษสวยงาม

แต่กลับมีเรื่องที่ชวนให้น้ำตาไหลพรากอยู่เบื้องหลัง

เรื่องราวของเกมนี้บางส่วนอิงกับเหตุการณ์ที่เกิดขึ้นจริงในโลกปัจจุบัน...

ลองเปิดใจเล่นเกมนี้ แล้วคุณจะเสียน้ำตาให้กับมันด้วยความตื้นตันอย่างแน่นอน

38370649.review: This is one of the only games I've ever cried over because of the story. Honestly, it was just a huge emotional roller coaster and I loved every minute of it. I did a completionist run in one go, it's really not too long of a game but it was enjoyable. Granted, most of the puzzles were pretty easy and it was a lot of back-and-forthing but I still found myself loving the story and everything going on in-game, so kudos.

38368633.review:
Oh my god! The Feels!!!!!


I'm a big fan of 16bit RPGs and this fits the bill. The story is very good, and while I tried to guess where it was going, I was surprised a couple of times. It's a sweet story, and while there is really no action or consequence, it's still fun to walk around, discover secrets, find items, solve puzzles, and progress the story. It's a fun casual play. Would definately recommed.

38368254.review: Rakuen is a beautifully made game similar to To The Moon but about 1000% better in everything -- the storyline, music, characters, gameplay. I could go on and on about how this is an amazing game - it's definitely a favorite!

38368127.review:
Rakuen is a game I truly want to like, but a few aggravating flaws resulted me unable to keep playing.

Its first sin is the engine of the game can only render a very small window of the game, or run in full screen with incorrect aspect ratio that causes everything to be stretched.  I am not sure how the creators of this game overlooked this glaring UX issue, but I guess I’m not actually looking for an excuse; it is not excusable.

Let’s talk about the plot next.  I liked the first chapter where an interesting cast of characters reside in a hospital, facing an unknown thief who has been stealing stuff.  But it took a down turn when the mother of the boy protagonist encouraged the boy (and also accompanying him) to the fantasy world in a story book.

Maybe the story would later explain why the boy, who appears to have some serious cancer that must be hospitalized, can make a trip to the book’s world and start doing cliched RPG-ish quests for fluffy cute NPC.  Even worse, the mother of the boy approved all these with seemingly blatant disregard of the boy’s health (and the consequences of their disappearing from the hospital).

In the end, I think the only thing the game does very well is the sound.  The bgm tracks are gorgeous, and little details like the footstep sound from across the wall, to progressive louder ticks when you move towards a clock, is quite impressive.

It’s unfortunate that to protect my own eyesight and sanity that I have to quit playing this game.  Hopefully the developers will learn a lesson here and make their next game a better one.

38334801.review:
Je ne sais même pas quoi dire sur ce jeu. C'est une expérience unique, pleine d'humour et de poésie. Les personnages sont très attachants, leur histoire est prenante. Tous les détails disséminés sur l'histoire des personnages ça et là prennent leur sens à mesure qu'on avance dans le jeu.
Le jeu arrive à nous faire pleurer (beaucoup !), mais également sourire en même temps, tant l'humour est présent.
Et puis la relation entre la mère et son enfant est très belle. Je n'en dis pas plus, je ne voudrais pas gâcher l'expérience. Mais je recommande vivement ce jeu.

Un grand merci à Laura Shigihara et à toutes les personnes qui ont rendu ce jeu possible

38333875.review:
Rakuen may have some blind spots in writing, some not so great gameplay ideas and slower-paced story moments, but at the end of the day, it delivers the goods. You know exactly what I mean by that, when you consider this a heavily story focused game in the style of To the Moon.

This title shares a lot of common ground with the one of the biggest indie tear-jerkers. It uses the same engine, controls, it lacks any combat and it also focuses mostly on telling the heart-touching story. There are several major differences though. Rakuen, in opposition to To the Moon, offers noticeable more gameplay mechanics, more open-ended world to discover and far longer run time. I believe that those changes both damaged and helped the game in several different aspects.

Story takes place in the hospital where a small boy with his loving mother discover portals to the alternative universe via family-inherited story book. In this colorful, fantasy world, interconnected with the real one, everybody has its own counterpart that faces similar joys, problems and fears. To awaken the legendary forest god and get granted a wish, boy and his mother need to help other patients in the hospital. This involves delving into their past experiences, learning their tragic stories that shaped them into who they are. Games jumps from helping one person to the next, dividing itself into seamless chapters, ending up with the climactic finale where developers bring up the biggest "guns" to this feels-train.

Game has a lot of plot ground to cover and added gameplay mechanics in form of fetch questing, exploration and some very weird puzzle solving also extend the playtime. The world and challenges are mostly alright, but I think that thanks to atrocious RPG-Maker style controls and feedback, game seems to drag a little in many places, especially when the story doesn't run on all cylinders. You can start to feel somewhat little disappointed, especially when some earlier characters' stories and general plot movements aren't remarkably memorable or engaging (ex. I think that Mom character was very underutilized in the beginning). 

That being said, you should not worry about the earlier parts of the game, since title really picks up the pace later on: putting some more interesting characters into motion, pulling some unexpected revelations and very pretty powerful moments. Some of those scenes, on top of being quite emotional, are also extremely clever with hints of foreshadowing hidden in the plain sight. I was very close to performing a standing ovation on the few last scenes. [i]That was a good one![/i] - it's the sentence I would like to share with the developers in those exceptional parts.

Despite my initial doubts about Rakuen having a fair chance against other titles in the genre, I would say that the ending and the game overall, brought a very satisfying experience worth recommending to anybody interested in story based games. If you liked To the Moon, you will definitely like this one too!

Rakuen may lack focus, presentation and polish sometimes, but I believe that it will be a pleasure for you to help this boy get his wish. [i]Take tissues[/i].

That game is definitely one of the best I've ever played, and I'll overlook any (very little) flaw I've found.
10/10 with no hesitation

if you were expecting something akin to to the moon, you'll definitely get that! but rakuen also is more than capable of standing out and being its own thing. and the tricks and mystery and puzzle are pretty cool!! TOTALLY WORTH OUR TIME XD

38268944.review: This game had me crying quite often. I do feel that production was a bit rushed towards the end. Recommend playing it though.

38247397.review: It always takes me awhile to get into these RPG Maker-style games, for some reason, but whenever I get into one, I have yet to be disappointed. Rakuen was no exception, and may have even left the others I've played in the dust. It is beautiful and dramatically heart-wrenching. The characters are well-written and interesting and the whole story feels meaningful. The visual design and music are stunning. Any minor negative feedback I may have had is erased by my desire to immediately recommend this to every human I know.

38229213.review: Amazing story and soundtrack. The story has a very deep meaning and rich emotions. Never lose hope no matter what it is and how hard it is. Always keep moving foward and live up with your dreams, your path you choose. 10/10 rating.

38223270.review:
First things first, AMAZING story and soundtrack. Lots of lovable characters and colorful art. Although more of a virtual novel than a game, worth it none the less. 

As one delves into this wonderful piece of art, there are a few things to note. Prepare for an emotional rollercoaster. Although meetings are brief the characters you incounter can be relatable in one way or another. And once you get that connection, it will hit hard. Another thing to note, the devotion and love put into this wonderful title. May not be the best game, or what would be considered "moneys worth" by many standards. I say don't take it by face value, give it a try with an open mind as there are many mini themes and tales featured in the game. It will be worth it.

My final thoughts, the situations / experiences of the characters are very real in the sense of being human. We all have hardships, but this games is a great reminder that we are not alone. Some one is always watching, and some one is always willing to lend a hand. And most importantly, the mother. Like any loving mother, this character helps her son in many situations as you adventure in Rakuen. Encouraging, soothing, caring and of course loving.

Like a mother, Laura's Devotion to her project, music, and fans we got this. A Glorious heartwarming experience that will never be forgotten.

38218526.review: 10/10, thought I was buying a sweet little adventure game, and now I'm in tears and not quite sure what to do with my life now. The music is beautiful, I recommend the bundle. Oh god, I can't think about it too much more or I'm gonna start crying again.

38105585.review:
10/10, made me cry until I got a dehydration headache. The controls were a bit annoying until I realised I could use the space bar to interact with things. Even when that was slowing my progress down, though, the story, the puzzles and the beautiful soundtrack kept me going.

If you liked To The Moon, you'll like Rakuen. But Rakuen actually has a lot more in the way of gameplay than To The Moon, and I'm pretty sure the story is longer. Whereas To The Moon sometimes felt like a pixel movie more than an actual game (albeit a really good movie), Rakuen has enough gameplay to actually feel like... well, a game.

38097943.review:
좌절로 주저앉은 자들을 위한 꿈의 낙원.

RPG 메이커로 제작된 쯔꾸르 게임이다. 쯔꾸르 게임이 늘 그렇듯 시나리오에 비중이 크게 잡힌 게임이고, 개성 넘치는 캐릭터들간의 대화와 감성이 느껴지는 스토리가 중심이 되는 게임이다. 게임의 구성으로써는 딱히 할 말은 없다면, 음악의 퀄리티가 높아 게임의 전반적인 분위기를 잘 잡아준다. 사실상 다른 스크립트 툴의 개입 없이 쯔꾸르 게임으로써 보여줄 수 있는 최선을 보여준 게임.

난치병으로 인해 병원에 입원한 소년이 되어 어머니와 함께 병원과 환상 세계를 번갈아 돌아다닌다. 이 과정에서 환자들이 지니고 있는 고민을 해결하고, 숲의 수호자인 모리조라에게 소원을 빌어 모든 꿈을 실현할 수 있는 환상의 낙원으로 가야만 한다. 고통으로 가득한 우울한 병원과 밝고 명랑한 환상 세계가 서로 대응을 이루고 있고, 한 쪽에서의 활동이 다른 한 쪽에 영향을 주기도 한다. '두 개의 차원'이라는 컨셉을 적절히 활용했고, 두 차원을 서로 넘나드는 것에 큰 위화감은 없다.

현실 세계(병원)에 입원한 환자들의 고민을 환상 세계에서의 활동을 통해 풀어나간다. 이 과정에서 그들이 지닌 말 못한 사연을 감상하게 되고, 주인공인 소년과 엄마의 활약과 환자의 응어리를 푸는 노래를 통해 숲의 마음을 획득해나간다. 현실 세계에서의 고민을 가상 세계의 형태를 통해 보여주고 또 풀어나가는 게임의 전개는 상당히 설득력있게 다가오면서 동시에 플레이어의 심금을 울린다. 큰 틀로 놓고 보면 시나리오의 완성도는 투 더 문에 비견할 수 있을 정도로 높은 편이다.

다만 스토리를 깊게 들여다보면 군데군데 헛점이 조금씩 드러난다. 우선 현실 세계와 가상 세계의 연결에 대한 설명이 조금 미흡한 감이 있다. 비유를 하자면 "1+1=2"의 공식에 등호가 빠져있는 느낌. 또한 별밤 축제 부분부터 결말부로 이어지는 게임의 후반부 이야기가 다소 모호하게 전달되는 감이 있다. 아무래도 게이머에게 어느 정도 추론의 여지를 준 듯 하다. 따라서 별도의 줄거리 해석이 필요할 듯 한데, 보다 명확한 줄거리를 선호하는 본인으로써는 조금 아쉽게 다가왔다.

게임 제작 툴의 한계가 명확하다면 꼭 그 한계를 뛰어넘으려 할 필요는 없다. 한계를 받아들이고 게임이 지닌 특성과 장점을 잘 이해할 수 있다면, 그 역시도 좋은 게임이 될 수 있다. 라쿠엔은 그걸 가장 잘 보여준 게임일 것이다.

// 2017.12.06 현재 한글패치를 적용할 경우, 클라우드나 도전과제가 제대로 적용되지 않는 현상이 있다. 주의할 것.

38084241.review:

출시 예정때부터 관심을 보였으나, 한글패치가 아직 없어도 어느정도 해석은 가능하나 완전한 이해를 할 수없기에 사는 것을 보류했었다.
그러나 블랙 프라이데이때 할인을 해서 사게 되었고, 때마침 머지않아 한글패치도 나오게 되었다.

일부 게임(ex.니어 오토마타)에선 트레일러 영상이 스포일러인 경우가 있다. 이 게임 또한 마찬가지이니, 가급적 보지 말고 게임하길 바란다.

38010327.review: 优美的BGM，感人的故事情节，紧张刺激的探索之旅。。。。。相比较《to the moon》可玩性着实提高了不少，不看攻略，一一探索，在打出结局的同时也把新患者休息室完美装修了一遍。。[spoiler] 本作中唯一让我不解的地方是麦芽绅士那一段，为什么要安排一个涂了粉红色假装是洋葱其实是苹果的角色，它的举动在游戏中很可疑，就在我认为他就是小偷的时候，真实却告诉我竟然是绅士本人？？然后作者也没有交代什么就这么糊弄过去了。。额，不要在意这些细节。。。[/spoiler]本作故事情节紧凑，从开始到结束可以看出解密的环节变得越来越简单。总的来说是一款不错的情感类角色扮演游戏。本作的每个场景的BGM都很不错，喜欢的同学可以搜索下载一下，晚上睡觉前听一听，绝对很舒服。

37977891.review: 小故事可能缺少新意，但是现实与童话的结合，近乎完美的配乐，最后穿插其中的主线将它们连在一起的时候，我认为它值得被称为神作。

37966654.review:
Antes de tudo... Eu acabei de zerar o jogo, no mesmo dia do meu aniversário, e estou a dois passos de chorar de emoção e tristeza por causa do final...

Na realidade eu já derramei algumas lágrimas. Foi o melhor presente de aniversário que eu pude ganhar, não conseguia pedir melhor. Acho que nem ganhar dois mil reais iriam me deixar mais realizado do que ter jogado esse jogo

O jogo é belo. As músicas são incríveis, a da tela inicial é a minha favorita. O jogo foca na história de personagens, onde a trama se passa em dois ambientes: Um Hospital, e uma dimensão pararela. 

O jogo apresenta puzzles, e se for para comparar com algo, pode-se dizer que são puzzles mais difícieis que Undertale, mas também não será necessário quebrar a cuca para resolve-los. Caso fique preso, não sinta vergonha em olhar na internet como resolve-lo, o foco do jogo não é esse.

Mesmo sendo um jogo focado em história, eu passei algumas várias horas jogando ele, como podem ver. Eu comprei ele na promoção que teve alguns dias atrás, então paguei relaticamente pouco. Mas acreditem, vinte contos por esse jogo é a mesma coisa que pular em um lago gelado e sair de lá com a mão cheia de pepitas de ouro. Dói na hora, mas depois a satisfação vale o suficiente para que, se vocÊ pudesse voltar no tempo, comprava o jogo de novo sem arrependimentos.

Nossa... na boa, eu não consigo explicar em palavras como eu amei esse jogo. Undertale é um jogo mais Mind-blow, Starbound é um jogo de exploração infinita, e Rakuen é um jogo de iluminar a alma. São esses os meus três games estilo Pixel que eu mais gosto.

37436956.review:
What is it:  Basically,  it is a mostly-linear (there are some sidequests), narrative-driven walking simulator that gives the extremes of good and bad feels.  It is an emotional journey detailing the lives, backstories, and struggles of incredibly sick people (my favorite of which to experience was the guy with basically early-onset Alzheimers).  You play a Boy in the hosptial and his goal is to make 5 patients / loved ones feel better so you can awaken a forest deity that will grant you a wish.

To me, some parts of the game had an incredible sense of unease to it, but that is because of very heavy foreshadowing in the beginning that works to the narrative's benefit.  It offers more to do than "To the Moon" without sacrificing any narrative.  

Within the first few moments of the game, you will know something is not quite right with the hospital.  This game definitely has a creepiness factor to it.

I say there is 7 hours to the main game.

The story-telling is the strong point and focus.  The exploration and sidequests were nice, but unnecessary value.

36460936.review:
TL;DR
I just finished playing Rakuen and first off, it was wonderful.

This game has so much heart put in to it and it really shows!
If you have been looking for a retro-styled adventure RPG with
good story and music, this game is for you.


Review:

Plot/Story:
The story in this game is fantastic without question. The characters
all have so much life put in to them and many of them really seem
real. Here is a brief rundown of the plot:
Rakuen is a game about a boy in a hospital. You play as him as
you travel through the fantasy world of Morizora's forest with 
your mother. Together you seek to wake up the guardian of the
forest to grant your wish. However, the guardian is asleep with
no sign of waking up. In order to wake up the guardian you must
walk a mile in the shoes of your fellow patients and in doing so,
you come to terms with your own story. 

Gameplay:
Simple enough, but that is all it needs to be. It's basically an 
interactive story with the occasionaly puzzle or quest to solve.
The real star in these kinds of games is always the story though.

Soundtrack:
From a game by Laura Shigihara, you should come to expect an
amazing sountrack and it does not dissapoint at all. I love all of
her other work, especially her work in Kan Gao's game, 
To the Moon (which I also recommend checking out).

So basically, if that sounds your style, pick it up! It will take you
roughly around 7-8 hours to beat and is well worth the $10 price
tag. Be ready for the possibility of crying of course. While the
finale didn't actually hit me that hard, there were some parts in the
middle that really got me reaching for the tissues to dry my eyes
so I could still play the game.

36424646.review:
The Good:
+ Beautiful artwork
+Good character design
+Relaxing: the kind of game where you can just have fun exploring in different environments
+Honest, well-done message/theme
+Plots with feels. All the feels.
+The puzzles aren't frustrating. You are given information on what to do and, for the most part, you're allowed to use the tools provided to solve them on your own. I felt a little patronized to now and again, but I think this game was meant for children as well as adults, so I won't hold that against it. Anyway, I'm a veteran of Cyan's games (as well as other, more traditional adventure games), so I like my puzzles on the extreme of the "give the player absolutely no information other than what's naturally provided by the setting" side. That's probably not true for everyone.

The Not-So-Good
+Characters aren't explored enough. The plots of their stories are well-done, but the only character who I felt like I actually got to know was Sue. However, I still cried a lot, so it's not like this flaw made the story horrible. It felt more like there was lost potential than like you were surrounded by two-dimensional people. Like you wanted to get to know everybody but weren't given that chance. 
+Consistent mechanics are nonexistent, aside from recycled things like fetch quests. Mechanic design is not this game's strength. I see a lot of these arbitrary mechanics in RPG Maker games, and I think that people get the idea that because Ib and The Witch's House had arbitrary puzzle mechanics, you don't need solid mechanics for a story-driven game. But the reason why those puzzles worked in those two games is because the environment was trying to use arbitrary puzzles to kill you. It wasn't supposed to make sense, and that's what made it work and even enhance the horror/mystery element. However, now that my rant is over, I should add that the overall game design flows pretty smoothly.
+The pacing is unbalanced. It's half-RPG, half-To the Moon type story and those two pieces weren't cut to fit together well. The mechanics feel like they sit on the surface of the story rather than working in a symbiotic relationship with it, and this inevitably leads to wonky pacing. Again, it doesn't make the game bad, but it feels like potential was lost. 

Overall, I had a lot of fun playing this game and the message came to me at a time when I needed it. It isn't perfect, but it certainly is lovable.

36167249.review:
I wanna preface this review by sayin' that I [i] Love [/i] Laura Shigihara and her work. Honestly, over my past few years as a 'gamer' Laura has always provided great songs and contributed many great tracks to multiple games. 

With that said, let's begin.

[h1] Rakuen, is it good? [/h1]

Rakuen, on the surface, seems like your typical 'RPGMaker' Game, the graphics aren't the greatest and the gameplay mechanics are basic and simplistic, like I said, a typical RPG of this nature.
But by no means does this mean [i] Rakuen [/i] is a bad game, in fact, I dare say, this is one of my most cherished Games of all time hands down. If not, one of my favorite RPG games of all time. Why? because it does things right.

As said before, it's mechanics are your typical pixelated game and the mechanics left much to be wanted. 

But they're not what makes this game so good. What makes this game so good is the emotionally-rich story within the game that is masked by the visuals.
Not only that, but the soundtrack, is masterfully crafted, the 'lullaby' style theme prevalent in many of Laura's works carry the emotional setting and tone of the events in the game well.
This is a perfect example of a 'balance' with the two aspects of the game complimenting each other rather than 'competing' one another to provide the player with a fantastic experience.

I often found myself crying every 5 minutes because of the songs playing in the background as I experience this wonderful journey.

But it's not without its flaws. The game often asks of you mundane tasks that are very 'repetitious' and requires constant back-tracking to complete.
But that can be easily over-looked not only because of the variety of them but also because they are short and sweet. 
Most people say this is where the game shines the most and I agree to a certain extent, the way Laura used her wit and creativity to overcome the technological limitations is interesting and doesn't cheapen the experience at all.

*Also, I can definitely say without a doubt this game will make you cry. That's no understatement, this game will try it's hardest to play your heart like a fiddle so a tissue box on-hand is recommended.*

I'll end the review here because if I go on I'll end up going to *spoiler* territory, but to leave on a high note, [i] [b] buy this game! [/b] [/i] Especially if you're the type to have loved games like Undertale and To the moon, this game will definitely provide.


A round of applause and praise for Laura Shigihara on her efforts and Passion as a contributor to the gaming world, well-done, and Thank-you!

9.7/10

35847038.review:
[h1][i]Rakuen[/i][/h1]

[h1]This Review is [i][b][u]Spoiler Free[/u][/b][/i].[/h1]

[b]This is worth every penny[/b]

[i]Hooooooooooo boy,[/i] where to start with [i]Rakuen[/i]?
First off, I want to start this by saying that I played [i]Rakuen[/i] at a relatively tough time in my life. One that left me slightly emotionally unsatble, but I think that helped me really come to understand the meaning behind this masterpiece of a game.

I've been a fan of Laura Shigihara for a while now, but mostly because of her singing. When I heard that she was makiing a game, I hopped right on the criminally small hype train and rode that baby all the way to Emotional Breakdown Station, which is a cheezy way of saying that I cried. A lot. This game left me a blithering mess for hours afterward, so be warned.

Now, let's get into the nitty gritty.

[b][u]The Story[/u][/b]
If you're looking for a good story, then you've found it. Rakuen is a story about a young boy in a hospital, so you know it's gonna be sad. It's quite a bit longer than the game that most people compare it to [i]To The Moon[/i] by about double the length, rounding out to about 10 hours of heavily story based gameplay. 

The story takes place (mostly) in the imagination of a young boy, and is split up into segments based on the person of focus. Everyone in the hospital has their own story, and each is more touching than the last. You explore a fantasy land of Too-Damn-Cute™ characters and areas, while learning the ins and outs of each patient at the hospital, all of which have their own fantasy counterparts. 

Every segment is sad in its own right, but all together they make a perfect flurry packed with enough emotion to last a lifetime.

[b][u]The Gameplay[/u][/b]
The gameplay in and of itself isn't compicated. RPG Maker iso perspective. Classic indie story title stuff. What makes it so enticing though, is the puzzles. While not being complicated, the puzzles have this perfect little quirk to them, that just makes them fun to solve. I don't know if it was the characters you interact with, or what but every little step in those puzzles was just a joy to solve. They all have life to them, and each one is specifically tailored to the character arc it's placed in. All of them make perfect sense in the world that they're built in, and that's something we haven't see very often in recent times, heck even [i]To The Moon[/i]'s puzzles didn't make full sense in why they were there (more specifically, the puzzles to go down a memory level).

[b][u]The Music[/u][/b]
I said before that I like Laura's music, and I'll say it again. I like Laura Shigihara's music. I primarily know this from her appearances in Kan Gao's music in all of Freebird's games, but she's absolutely outdone herself with an entirely original soundtrack for [i]Rakuen[/i]. Each track perfectly fits the area it was used in and designed for, and while I found some of the songs to be a little hard to listen to outright, most didn't have that problem.

If you enjoyed the music as much as I did, you can get it on bandcamp [url=https://laurashigihara.bandcamp.com/album/rakuen-official-soundtrack]here[/url] or on steam here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/572910/


[b][u]Rant[/u][/b]
I played this game in a very emotional state. My dog and best friend of the past eleven years had just died not two weeks prior, and that helped me really [i]click[/i] with this game. I'm glad that I played it when I did, and I think it'll really help for me to look back on it and reflect later on in life.

Honestly, I sat there sobbing for at least two hours over this fuckin' game. It hit me like a fuckin' truck.

/rant

I made this review with the assumtion that most people here will have at least heard of [i]To The Moon[/i], but in case you haven't, you can find it here: http://store.steampowered.com/app/206440/

or you can find its sequel here (coming soon, to theaters near you): http://store.steampowered.com/app/337340/

and hey, if you want, you can even read my review on it [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/FP42/recommended/206440/]here[/url].

35558240.review:
Rakuen ist ein sehr liebevoll gestaltetes Indie-Adventure, das vor allem mit seiner detailverliebten Welt sowie einem grandiosen Sounddesign und einer tollen Story überzeugen kann.
Um einen kurzen Überblick über die Hauptaspekte des Spiels zu geben:

+ emotionale & fesselnde Story/Stories
+ detailverliebtes Worlddesign
+ schöner Grafikstil
+ grandioses Sounddesign

- wenig wirkliches "Gameplay"
- langatmiger Spielstart

Gefesselt hat mich vor allem die liebevoll gestaltete Welt, die mit viel Charm, Fantasie und Witz aufwartet. Dazu passt der bunte (abgesehen vom Krankenhaus) Grafikstil, der allen Liebhabern von Pixelart bzw. dem üblichen RPG-Maker Stil gefallen dürfte. Auch die vielen verschiedenen Figuren, die man im Laufe des Spiels kennenlernt können überzeugen; stecken voller Witz und Charakter. Fast erinnert mich das Charakterdesign sogar ein bisschen an Undertale, da hier wirklich kreative Ideen und Dialoge aufwarten, die mich einige Male wenn nicht lachend, dann doch zumindest schmunzelnd zurückgelassen haben. 

Das wichtigste Element des Spiels stellt in meinen Augen jedoch die Story dar. Dabei dreht sich das Geschehen gar nicht so sehr um die Hauptstory eines Jungen, der im Krankenhaus behandelt wird, und durch die Geschichten seiner Mutter einen Weg in eine Art Fantasiewelt findet. Vielmehr geht es um die vielen kleineren Geschichten, die in die Hauptstory eingebettet sind. Hier ist es den Entwicklern gelungen, ähnlich wie in To The Moon eine emotionale Bindung an die Charaktere zu erzeugen, sodass ich an der ein oder anderen Stelle doch einige Tränchen vergießen musste.

Unterlegt wird das Ganze von entsprechender Musik, die je nach Situation mal unaufdringlich-fröhlich im Hintergrund dudelt, mal in emotionalen Gesangseinlagen einen Höhepunkt findet, und insgesamt eine große Abwechslung bietet. Mit Laura Shigihara genießt das Spiel übrigens dieselbe Kompononistin wie auch To The Moon, und das hört man auch.

Die einzigen Kritikpunkte meinerseits sind der Mangel an wirklichem Gameplay (was ich persönlich nicht unbedingt störend finde) á la To The Moon, sowie einzelne Strecken zwischendurch, bei denen man öfter mal ein paar Minuten hin- und herrennt. Auch der Einstieg ins Spiel war mir persönlich etwas zu langweilig, erst nach der ersten Stunde nimmt das Spiel an Fahrt auf.

Alles in allem eine klare Kaufempfehlung für Leute, die auch schon To The Moon oder ähnliche Spiele gemocht haben.
Die Spielzeit betrug bei mir knapp 10 Stunden, wobei ich auch an dem ein oder anderen Rätsel mal ein paar Minuten festgehangen habe. Insgesamt halte ich den aktuellen Preis von 10€ deshalb für absolut fair.

35449633.review:
For me, Rakuen is an amazing showcase of video games as an art medium. Combining the cinematic storytelling with the exploration mechanics of classic Zelda titles, Rakuen is an incredibly personal project and you can really feel its creator's touch on every aspect of the game. As a non-combat, story-focused game created with RPG maker, I'll try to focus my review on these elements specifically.

Thematically, it's probably easier to compare Rakuen to titles outside gaming realm such as the animated movie 'Spirited Away'. Rakuen's main themes are family, friendships and the duality of life & death, which it generally handles pretty well - even though the pacing, depending on the player may seem overly melancholic and in some instances even pushy. I've seen many people hype this game up mainly as a tear-jerker, what for me feels both as an overstatement and disregard to other parts of the story which I found great. I do think that Rakuen has a touching plot, but the real highlight for me was its amazing side characters and hilarious writing that acted as a good counterpart for the overrall sad tone.

On a mechanical level, Rakuen shines. The limitations of the engine and how the developer approaches them is often a good way of judging a game, and Rakuen feels like the framework was created for it and not the other way around. Completely dropping combat aspects works well, and the usually tedious puzzle-solving of RPGM titles is done in a way that entwines it well with the story. For me however, the enjoyability of said puzzles varied greatly. A classic Zelda-esque dungeon was an amazing experience, but some of the more cramped and ominous parts felt monotone and only times I wished for a peek in the walkthrough.
Graphically Rakuen is a treat with good character design, beautiful enviroments and fitting effects. The unique artstyle coupled with original soundtrack might not be for everyone, but they really nail home the creator's passion for the project.

Overall, Rakuen deserves the praise it's gotten - if it had been published to a handheld console ten years ago, it would be definitely praised as a classic gem by now. Even now, it's a great example for both what you can do with such a simple engine and the emotional complexity videogames are able to achieve.

35008816.review:
Бытует мнение, что на RPG-Maker'е не существует годных игр. Не-не-не, фаны To the Moon — погодите кидать в меня камнями. Ведь я сам восторгаюсь ей настолько, насколько это вообще возможно. И Луну-то я как раз сюда приплёл неспроста, ведь сегодняшний наш гость — прямое её наследие.

Поприветствуйте Rakuen — игрушку, прекрасную и замечательную во всём. Именно с таких громких слов хотелось бы стартовать. Почему? Давайте разбираться.

Лаура Шигихара — человек, подаривший миру чудесную композицию Everyrhing's Alright из уже упомянутого шедевра To the Moon, довольно внимательно переварив успех прошлого проекта, взялась за свою собственную игру. Значит ли это, что Rakuen во многом похожа на предшественницу? И да, и нет одновременно. Вообще, игры на RPG-Makere внешне действительно очень схожи друг с другом, по-настоящему уникальные детали и образы попадаются крайне редко. Поэтому о визуальном стиле подопытного я скажу лишь пару ласковых: в дозволительных рамках движка он очень даже неплох и приятен глазу. Да к чёрту графику, кто в здравом уме будет заикаться о ней, когда речь идёт о RPG-Maker'е? Сюжет, значит, ага.

Итак, история стартует от лица некого безымянного мальчика, который по не оговорённым причинам попадает в больницу. Здесь мы знакомимся с постояльцами других палат, каждый из которых очень необычен и колоритен, и, что более важно, у каждого из которых есть определённая проблема, мешающая шагать по жизни с высоко поднятой головой и улыбкой на лице. Вот тут-то и начинается сказка. Да-да, сказка — в плане подачи истории Rakuen иначе и не назовёшь. Благодаря особой книге и специальному ключу наш герой получает возможность путешествовать в другой мир, который напрямую связан с миром настоящим. Он выглядит совершенно иначе, нежели сухое наполнение больницы — волшебно, сказочно — но населяющие его существа фактически дублируют реальных людей, хотя здесь они и выглядят совсем иначе. Задача, ставящаяся перед игроком почти с самого начала — разбудить лесного духа Моризору, чтобы тот исполнил сокровенное желание — требует от нас следующего решения: найти пять частей особой песни, которая должна развеять сон хранителя. Как мы будем её выполнять? Ответ лежит на поверхности — помогая тем самым ключевым персонам, упомянутым чуть ранее.

Чем в первую очередь цепляет Rakuen — так это именно переплетением двух миров. На этом не только зиждутся многие загадки (сделай что-то в реальности, чтобы определённый проход открылся в другом мире), но и сам геймплей подразумевает постоянные переходы туда-сюда. Назвав игру сказкой, я умышленно привил ей многие присущие типичным сказкам особенности — так оно и есть. Но нельзя не упомянуть заложенную драму и серьёзность, которые прячутся за всей этой сказочной оболочкой. Уверяю — проходить через истории персонажей (typical повествование внутри повествования, завязанное на иносказании и метафорических образах) и узнавать всё больше подробностей об их прошлом, а в частности — о тяжком грузе на их сердцах, с каменным лицом выйдет разве что у сухой овсяной печенюшки. 

В отличии от "камерной" To the Moon, в Rakuen'e нам предоставляют определённую свободу действий. Конечно, далеко не во все области можно попасть с самого начала игры, но именно в этом и заключается изюминка. Изучение мира, а также поиск разнообразных дополнительных плюшек дарят очень приятные ощущения. Пазловые загадки в подавляющем большинстве имеют обожаемый мною олдово-классический вид (найди такой-то предмет, используй его там-то, получи новый ключик, открывающий проход, и так далее). 

Раз в начале была упомянута Лаура — никак нельзя обойти стороной аудио наполнение, верно? И несложно догадаться, что она со своей задачей справилась на все 10 из 10 — музыка в игре шикарна, а от сдобренных приятнейшим Лауровским вокалом песен ловишь мурашки по всему телу. Да зачем далеко идти — первый ушной оргазм можно словить просто находясь в главном меню. 

Есть такие проекты, ещё даже не завершив прохождение которых, ты заранее знаешь, что когда-нибудь вернёшься к ним снова, дабы ещё раз испытать всю гамму чувств и эмоций. Rakuen в мой личный список уже заскочил, а заскочит ли в ваш — предлагаю убедиться на собственном опыте.

Если брать в сравнении с To the Moon, то там всё это грамотно подавалось вперемешку с "цинизмом" главных героев и вопросами, интригующими или морально спорными, которые  задавал игрок вместе с этими главными героями. В Undertale вся "приторность" подавалась очень небольшими порциями и пряталась за огромным количеством шуток, мелких деталей, которые вы могли выцепить в окружении или диалогах, а также была вперемешку с реально ужасно жестокими моментами, что создавало невероятно мощный эмоциональный коктейль.
2) Мало ключевых образов в повествовании. Когда мы говорим о сюжете Андертейл, нам на ум приходят золотые цветы, ножи, "But nobody came..." и т. д. и огромное количество моментов, которые со всеми этими образами связано. То же с To the Moon- луна, бумажные кролики, маяк... А в этой игре разве что только стеклянные шарики. А это ведь очень важно, чтобы обозначить важные моменты истории. 
3) Полную версию песни подзапороли
Что понравилось:
1) Несмотря на мой первый пункт, игре получилось меня растрогать (правда, только в финальной своей главе)
2) Игра просто очаровательна в своей простоте, напоминает этой своей чертой Stardew Valley
3) Очень лёгкий и приятный геймплей, за которым расслабляешься
4) Чайный клуб бесподобен!

34962831.review:
Rakuen is a simple, yet beautiful and very emotional game. The game tells the story about an unnamed boy and his adventures through Morizora's Forest and the hospital he is currently being hospitalized at. Both of the worlds are interconected, and changes in one affect the other.  

Being a songwriter, Laura herself composed and designed the music tracks, and they couldn't fit the game better. The soundtrack is amazing and its a huge part of the game, the characters are unique, have an interesting design and backstory and you are always curious about what is going to happen next.

The game, however, has a slow pace and a more childish tone, mostly due to the secret that is reveled at the end. This isn't a demerit, but simply a characteristic that might push some people aside. Still, having followed the project since 2014, I can't be more happy with the results and definitely recommend the game to anybody interested in great storywriting and songwriting

34956958.review:
Beautiful, astonishing game. 

Obviously the subject matter can be grim, and to the game's eternal credit, it does not mess around with platitudes or false comforts. That being said, most people will find the overall experience hopeful, adorable, and downright delightful. 

If you are currently battling illness, I think it will comfort you. You'll follow multiple characters struggling with various health problems, having different emotional reactions to their trials and their caretakers. This game delivers a wise and thorough treatment of the many manifestations of suffering - and generosity - in a human heart. That specificity and nuance in the game is why we want to use it in our program. The game rewards empathy and loving kindness, as does life. 

If you are a caretaker, I think you would find it encouraging. I've spent 20 years helping my family care for a loved one with dementia. It's easy to let a cloud of sorrow hang over every interaction, growing a little more hopeless every time you are with them. It's hard to remember that creativity is...well, allowed! That sounds funny, but it's true. Rakuen shows a Mother doing just that, pouring out a story and adventure that heals her child's heart, even as she cannot control what will heal his body. (Also, this is the best mom in video game history, in my opinion.)

When my family started to "play" in how we cared for my loved one, and let ourselves try anything we could think of to increase her well being and comfort, our reward was not so much a recovery of the person she was - the disease took that long ago - but a chance to enjoy and love the person she had become. She could laugh, if we told the right kind of joke. She could sing, if we played the right music. She could tell stories, if we were patient and worked to draw them out of her. One of the characters in the game also has what seems to be a form of dementia, and you help him "speak" what is in his heart at one point. I would tell people to buy this game just for that one moment.  

It's not a "hard to watch" experience. If you've played That Dragon, Cancer, there is a similar balance between the trials and hopes, though I think Rakuen offers more escape and relief as you play it. That's a good thing, as it is hours longer! There are real moments of foreboding, yes, and right from the very beginning. But there's also wit, whimsy, nerdy fun humor, love, and joy. A suffering person is never always sorrowful, just as a happy person is never always happy. The humans in this game, and their magical counterparts, feel like that, and so seem very real. 

Congrats to the team behind this lovely game. You did an amazing job!

Please give it a read and let me know if you like/have an issue with anything I have said.

Here is an excerpt that summarizes why I love this game so much:



" “Rakuen” tackles the injustices of life and the benefit of doing good things in genuine ways.. The game never underestimates the looming presence of death that follows around each patient but also shows that even those who are stricken with melancholy can change and make amends. The bonds you form are the most valuable things to a person, and this game poignantly makes the player understand this. As the player drinks tea at the lavish parties in Morizora’s Forest and traverses the vivid memories of misery and merriness of other patients, the message of the game becomes clear.

If you’ve lived a life with strong connections to the people around you, then you can breath your last breaths with no regrets."

34953757.review:
I've played so many videogames in my life and there are a few that have found their way into my heart and forever left a mark. Rakuen has now joined that group.

Rakuen really showcases that big set pieces, explosions and bombastic music are not needed to enhance a game and story. The key to really immerse the player is to make the game world and its inhabitants feel natural and act in a way that makes sense. With that said, Rakuen is nowhere near an "ordinary" world and its approach to magic and wonder is what really captured my attention and in the end my heart.

You will get to know a wide range of characters and at the end of the game you'll really miss them. You care for them, you want to see what they do next. Each character felt unique and each of the "main NPCs" got their own arcs and stories told within the bigger story of Rakuen. In the end it all connects in an emotional and a natural way.

The music is probably my favorite part of Rakuen. I bought the full soundtrack even before I started playing the game itself just because I heard one of the songs on Youtube. Gosh, these songs will pull at your heartstrings!

I don't wanna discuss the game more because this game is best experienced if you don't know too much about the world of Rakuen beforehand. Boot up the game and just immerse yourself in Rakuen and get to know its inhabitants. When you come to "The End" I assure you you would have felt happiness, sorrow, anger, fear, hate and love.

Prepare your heart for Rakuen

34912307.review:
[h1]Is Rakuen a Good Game? What Makes it Good?[/h1]
Of course, everyone does have opinions, so no game will fully appeal to everyone. This game, Rakuen, CERTAINLY appealed to me, though. In fact, it appealed to me so much to the point of me creating a character inspired by this game named 'Rakuen'. 
So what about this game made me fall in love with it? Why did I continue to devote time into this game? If you're like me, a game is considered beautiful and artistic if it plays a beautiful soundtrack, tells a beautiful story, has a beautiful meaning, possesses a beautiful motivation, displays a warm, approachable art style, and does a good job presenting these aspects. Laura Shigihara, the creator of this game, meets that whole criteria, and is, in my opinion, the "total package" regarding RPG's.

[h1]Why is Rakuen Worth Buying and Playing?[/h1]
[strike]Steam trading cards[/strike] Rakuen has good gameplay, yes. Rakuen also provides incredible Steam items (backgrounds, emotes, etc), yes. But one of the primary reasons you should purchase Rakuen is because of the pure beauty of it. As mentioned before, Rakuen has an outstanding soundtrack, an outstanding story, outstanding art, and an outstanding motivation behind the characters.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
9.5/10 | Soundtrack: Soundtrack includes beautiful piano-playing, warm vocals, and a unique style.
10/10 | Story: Story includes an emotional connection to characters, motivational meaning, and a warm, cute feeling to the story being told.
9/10 | Art: The sprites and art of the game warmly give off a cute feeling. I feel the soundtrack fits the smooth, unique art style very well.

[i]Side Notes:[/i]
[i]*Rakuen does have additional, optional objectives apart from the story, giving a reason to play the game a second time or for achievements.[/i]
[i]*Fun fact: Rakuen (rawk-quen) is the Japanese word for "pleasure forest" or "paradise". Keeping this fact in mind when playing the game will make it easier to collect the emotions and feelings the story attemts to give off.[/i]

As I've grown older, I've noticed that it's not just the endings and goodbyes that make me well up, but the small acts of compassion. More than anything, I feel like that's what Rakuen's about. It's so honest and sees the good in everyone. 

This is a lovely, simple game that uses the most basic of gameplay systems-- walking, searching, reading, pondering-- to tell a story that slowly grows into something genuinely magical and bittersweet. The soundtrack has the same effect: it's hard to notice how special it is until you look back when everything is over.

As long as this world has people like Laura Shigihara making things like Rakuen, I think we'll be alright.

34815867.review:
It isn't easy writing a review for Rakuen. It obviously does not come with cutting edge technological innovations in user interface or game mechanics, but I'll still rate it a 9.5/ 10. Guessing the budget, scope, tools at hand, and the asking price- the small development team has come up with a little gem that will not be easy to forget. Where Rakuen may lag behind the AAA games, it more than makes up in its heart and Emotion Quotient (EQ).


Art in Rakuen is endearing, and slightly reminiscent of Stardew Valley's. In particular portraits of two little children stand out- their expressions a joy to look at. The high aesthetics in the visual department are equally matched in music, another draw of the game. Sure the game has slight flaws in places with plot devices, some disjointedness, some repetition. But these are minor considering what the game successfully accomplishes.

In summary, Rakuen is a game that gently explores Love, Life, and Loss. While promoting values of goodness, caring, empathy- and considering how much the world needs these virtues today, Rakuen easily earns my very high recommendation.

Update: Nominated Rakuen for “The World Is Grim Enough Let's Just All Get Along” award

34744074.review:
A great game with some perplexing design issues. I haven't finished Rakuen yet, but despite some extremely transparent plot devices, it's exceptionally beautiful, funny, and well made. The soundtrack and art are fantastic, and the use of more surreal humour in places gives it a great oddball touch... something it desperately needs given how heavy the plot gets.

The downside is that some aspects of design feel strange. There's no sprint function, which starts to grate early on, and so many of the puzzles not only rely on tedious back-and-forthery, but also seem really disconnected from what's going on in the story. They feel like arbitrary obstacles... unscramble a code, push a block, find a thing to mix stuff in even though there are BUCKETS AND BEAKERS RIGHT THERE OH MY GOD. Given how heavily Rakuen relies on symbolism and the strength of its plot and cast elsewhere, thus far all the puzzles I've come across have kind of felt like busywork, particularly the stuff revolving Gemma's plot. 

Still, if you're looking for something heartfelt, lovely, and smart, you can hardly go wrong here. Rakuen is still an instant, effortless recommendation more people should be playing.

34717775.review:
Dear Laura Shigihara,

please let me express my heartfelt thanks for your mailing-list e-mail dated 26 April - usually I never pay mass e-mails much attention, but something compelled me to read yours anyway. And I kept it in the back of my head.
Finally I bought your game last Friday. I can't say I was hooked from the beginning - to my shame, it felt a little stringy getting used to going around the hospital, feeling estranged from everyone and everything. After some days of reflecting on it I know the reason I felt this way - because of my own social exclusion I am experiencing right now. I feel detached from everyone and find it hard to bond to people - whether it be old friends or potential new ones. And after an hour or so of playing Rakuen, I stopped and returned to League of Legends.

Still, after some rounds of League, something compelled me to advance further in Rakuen. I don't know yet what exactly had driven me, because I wasn't very invested then, as I mentioned above. Maybe it was the prospect of a story - most games I play nowadays are sandbox or otherwise have the potential to spread in any direction for an endless amount of time or replay value. I need some constraint, I feel. If you can call it that. I need some constraint for my own thoughts, otherwise they overwhelm me and flow out of me without any sense, scattering into all the directions of the wind, like spilt milk covering wooden floor planks, seeping into the clefts.

I value a good story above all else. Since I am not able to wring some from my own hands yet. I admire you for doing what I cannot.

And a breathtaking story is exactly what I got.
I remember starting crying around Tony's story arc and I don't think I stopped weeping for long periods afterwards. There were so many incredibly strong and meaningful images, elevated by your astounding music, accompanied by your heart-piercing dialogues... I don't want to spoil the experience for others reading this, so I won't put any details, but there are so many ways the fates are intertwined, a song might fit more than one of the story lines, a person you feel is nothing more than a side character becomes the true main character (to me, at least) and it feels enlightening thinking about it and then letting your whole range of empathic feelings take control for just the slightest amount of time - they get so little exposure to the outside world...

Rakuen is a masterly crafted piece of art, an all-encompassing holistic experience that tugged at my soul and made me cry very painful tears that came flowing directly from my stringy heart. The very same stringy heart that made the first one or so hours of playing Rakuen stringy in my own mind. After I overcame my own struggle, your game became something I needed dreadfully at that stage of my life. And which I will value highly as one of the most beautifully written stories in my whole life.

And thus I want to wholeheartedly say "Thank-you" (including the hyphen) - not only for the e-mail I received, because I got music from your bandcamp like an eternity ago, but also for everything you went through to create this game. All the sad nights and the depressing thoughts, all the stressful moments, all the hard work. You as a person are one of my personal heroines - because you do the things I am not yet ready for and it feels like I'll never really be. Which is "simply" doing it at all, whereas I am not even starting. Which is going through with a project that seems impossible to tackle. Which is completing an idea that once just was a small flickering flame in your mind. Thank-you for starting developing this game, thank-you for going through with it, thank-you for completing it and sharing it with all of us!

Thank-you! <3

I've followed the creators other works for years, so am probably a little biased, but I really loved Rakuen.

Rakuen is one of the best examples of the way games not only tell stories, but allow you to experience the emotions of others. It tells a charming, beautiful, but sad, story about a boy and his mother as they journey through both a hospital ward and a magical land. The pixel artwork is beautiful and the music is excellent.

The game is a little short, but given the weight of the story, I think that's okay. I think I should also say that the story can hit you quite hard, so go in prepared for to cry a little. Overall I think this is both a good game and an important game. I think it's worth your money, time and maybe tears.

34615636.review:
Laura's talent has truly shone on every project she's taken on in the past. But Rakuen is perhaps the fruition of all that work, a game that touched a very rare spot in the heart of any gamer who has been deeply touched by a video game.

It's pretty clear from the premise that we are in for some unique storytelling, but what the summary will not tell you is how much discovering the world of Rakuen feels like the most beloved games of the SNES era. It's not trying to hail back to that time; it's just the sort of game that's too rare these days. Beautiful, heartfelt dialogue and quirky comedy take turns as we learn about our protagonist and the world he inhabits. In all the games I've played over the last 20 years, I have never once played a terminally ill child. This is a brilliant story option and thrilling to me as it's a brand new experience.

Video games are not often tender, but Rakuen is. It has a sense of wonder. It's fully plugged into the human experience and all its ups and downs. And the fantasy side of it is so enveloping that there's never a moment where you don't believe in it entirely. I don't want to ruin any of its secrets, but I will say that the connection between Rauken and the human world is one that left me thinking even after the game is closed. The story is part fantasy, but there's a lot of reality woven into it. Those two juxtapose so beautifully it's made Rakuen one of the most memorable titles I have played all year.

If you miss the quirkiness of The Secret of Evermore and the fantastic worlds of Chrono Trigger you are going to love Rakuen. Surely it was inspired by them, but I think it could easily have existed right beside them in its own right. That's praise I can rarely give to any game – that it could stand right next to the classics and look right at home.

34607524.review: I love this game. For the Japanese language and/or culture learner, you get tidbits throughout the game that are really cool to notice bundled in a beautiful game. Unlocking achievements is cool, but if you want a game that you can easily play through for the storyline, Rakuen gives it to you. Very strongly recommended.

34592029.review:
I had followed Rakuen’s development for 3 years, ever since composer Laura Shigihara announced she was working on a game of her own, and it definitely didn’t disappoint.

The story is where this game shines. You play as a young boy confined to a hospital. Together with his Mom, he discovers a fantastical storybook world with parallel versions of all his fellow patients and works to learn about their stories. The line between fantasy and reality is hopelessly blurred, but the beautiful thing is it doesn’t really matter – the story’s message is still crystal clear. And the message is truly unique, exploring hope and sorrow in equal measures. There are no miraculous recoveries for these patients – the reward for learning their stories is simply understanding and empathy, both for the patients themselves and for their loved ones. 

Another strong point is the music. Shigihara has always been a fantastic composer, and this might be her best work yet. The vocal songs are beautiful, heartwarming, and sorrowful all in one, while the other tracks are a bit bouncier. The story wouldn't have nearly the same emotional impact if it wasn't for the music.

The areas the game suffers most in are all related to its engine, RPG Maker. Though the character artwork is great, the sprites themselves are usually not stellar. Movement is quite sluggish, with no option to speed things up. And the resolution is totally broken, letting you only choose between a super small window and full-screen with the edges cut off. None of thees issues are gamebreaking but they do pull you out of the experience from time to time.

Despite that, I can heartily recommend this game for anyone who likes a slow, emotional story. The To the Moon comparison is apt, as both games scratch the same itch. It mmight not be flashy, but this game is still not to be missed,

34589689.review:
Rakuen Review (NO SPOILERS)

When you become really passionate and engrossed in playing several types of video games, you come to a point where you start to experience something called "The Void". The Void is the feeling you get when you experience a game that's SO incredibly good in every single way, that you truly believe that you'll never again play a game as good as the one you've just discovered. The game was so perfect and so magical, that it made a lifelong lasting impression on you that you're never going to forget. It surpasses everything you've seen before it, and you don't think anything you'll see in the future will ever top that. It goes without saying that Rakuen most definitely made me feel The Void.

When Laura Shigihara (also known as Supershigi) first announced Rakuen back in 2014, the trailer alone was enough to tell me that this was going to be an incredibly special game. I've had a lot of times where I buy a game just because of the box art. I just have a feeling that the game will be good, and 9 times out of 10, that method has never disappointed me. It's actually how I discovered my favorite game of all time, NiGHTS: Journey of Dreams. But when seeing Rakuen's trailer, I didn't just think it would be good. I truly believed that it would turn out to be one of my favorite games of all time. And I just HAD to play it.

Fast forward a few years, and Rakuen has finally been shared with the world. Right off the bat, you're able to see that this game is going to be a very emotional experience. But it's actually very surprising in just how many different types of emotions it manages to make you feel. Something that's important to acknowledge is that its not just a compilation of sad stories. They're stories of how to recover from sad events. You'll get attached to these characters and feel heartbroken for the things that they go through, for sure. But you'll also get such wise and powerful advice on how to recover from times like these, if you by any chance can relate to any of these characters. It gives hope in an environment that first appears to be seemingly hopeless. Rakuen will not only make you cry with its sad moments, but feel hopeful and inspired with their conclusions. Not only that, but there's tons of bright and hilarious moments that'll make you laugh out loud, as well as a lot of dark and suspenseful moments that'll truly frighten you. In short, this game has everything.

Now let's move onto the art of this game. I know I'll get a lot of hate for saying this, but I'm usually not that big a fan of pixel graphics. I've just sorta had my fill of them and kinda get underwhelmed, while everyone else around me is going "ERMAHGERD! PIXEL NOSTALGIAAAAA!" But despite this, Rakuen manages to impress me IMMENSELY with its beautiful environments and detailed character sprites. I'd go as far as to call it the most gorgeous pixel art I've ever seen in a game. It also manages to combine pixel areas with backgrounds that look like they were hand-painted, and it all mixes together so well. The game also has these beautiful storybook portraits (drawn by Emmy Toyonaga) that pop up, whenever a character is speaking. This gives the characters so much more personality and brings them to life in a whole new way. Though, there are SOME characters that have SO much personality in both spirit and design, that they don't even need a character portrait to show that. Those who've played the game will know who I'm talking about. ;) From the characters, land, sea and sky, Rakuen's art is truly something to behold.

The hits don't stop there! Not by a long shot! Anyone whose familiar with Laura Shigihara's work knows that she's a phenomenal music composer! You can thank her for the beautiful music in the critically acclaimed "To The Moon". So it goes without saying that Rakuen has the bar set high, for having an awesome soundtrack. And it most definitely does not disappoint. Every scene becomes 10 times more powerful and engaging, with its accompanying track. Music plays such a big role in Rakuen. Not only in bringing more life to every environment and scene, but also in telling its story. I'd go into more detail, but that would just ruin the surprise. Rakuen is very much a game that's best experienced, firsthand.

And that's something I gotta acknowledge. Despite how story driven it is, Rakuen is still first and foremost a game. So how well does it do, in that department? Survey says... just as good as everything else! The main gameplay mechanic comes from exploring all the areas, collecting things that'll unlock new tools that'll unlock achievements or new areas, and solving puzzles. The puzzles are easy enough to not bring your progress to a grinding halt, but are clever enough to make you really stop and think. They're also very clever in the design aspect, as well. Some puzzles are visual based, some are audio based. And sometimes its just as simple as listening to what the people around you say, and not forgetting it. I really like to think that having a story play with your mind counts as a gameplay mechanic, as well. You'll be trying to put all the pieces together, as you gather information on all the big secrets in this game. And if you were to replay this game, you'll end up seeing a lot of subtle hints that you might not have caught, your first time around.

The game also has a lot of side quests, to break up the pace of the main story. The achievements are simple enough to get and fun enough for you to WANT to 100% this game. Besides, if you do the side quests, then that just means that you get to play Rakuen even longer! And that is most certainly a good thing! The game is fairly short, so anything that can keep me in this world for a longer period of time is most welcomed, in my book. I don't know how else I can say it. Rakuen does everything right. Simple as that.

To call this game a labor of love is an understatement. As somebody who was fortunate enough to be one of the beta testers for Rakuen, I was able to see first hand just how much work went into making every detail as perfect as it could possibly be. It's a beautiful piece of art, in both visuals and sound. It's easy and accessible for anyone to get into, regardless of their gaming experience or taste in game genres. And most importantly, its beautiful story and amazing characters are something that'll leave a lifelong impact on you, as well as help you make a difference in your life and in the world around you. From the moment I saw it, I knew I would love Rakuen. And when I finally got to play Rakuen, it met every single expectation I had for it, and so much more. It's something that should be played and experienced by everyone. I hope you all enjoy it as much as I did. Rakuen is and forever will be one of my favorite games of all time.

Rakuen gets a 10/10

34572008.review:
I bought this game because to me, the idea of playing a boy and his mom as main characters is a fresh and unique concept that is rarely explored in a game. So the potential was there; combined with the nice art and really good music, why the thumbs down then? 

First of all, the game is not super-bad. I thought long about it but given that we only have the binary choice it tended more to the 'bad' side. The story is very predictable in a bad way. It's just a string of little sub stories to pull your heart strings in the most blatant ways (oh, this poor lonely puppy and her little girl-friend who is poor and has an alcoholic dad, gee, I wonder what will happen???). 

The bigger problem is the actual gameplay, though. It's just not engaging in any way. You mostly run around the world and listen to cutesy creatures talking and collect some objects to get to the next plot point. The puzzles are very light and easy, and there aren't that many of them. It's really just running around and talking for the most part. The game is not long, but it still kind of drags on.

I think if you are a parent and you play this with your (really) young kid, than this game is worth playing, maybe. So as a family game, I would recommend it. For everyone else, I would only recommend it if you really enjoy the art and music.

34398034.review:
Forse vi ricorderete di Laura Shigihara come colei che aveva curato le splendide musiche e cantato i bellissimi brani dell'ormai famoso To The Moon - ebbene, ha deciso di fare tesoro dell'esperienza e di creare un gioco sempre con RPG-Maker per conto proprio (o quasi), Rakuen appunto.

In Rakuen siamo un simpatico bambino col cappello di carta ricoverato in ospedale per qualche ragione, che tramite un misterioso libro può accedere a una dimensione alternativa e fiabesca popolata dai Leebles, strane creaturine rosa, e dal dio dormiente Morizora, in grado di esaudire un desiderio a chi fosse in grado di svegliarlo.
Accompagnato dalla sua mamma sempre prodiga di amorevoli consigli o di commenti più o meno utili, il bambino scopre ben presto che per svegliare Morizora è necessario prima risolvere i problemi delle persone che lo circondano.

La Foresta di Morizora, come viene chiamata questa strana dimensione forse realmente esistente o forse no, è infatti una sorta di specchio del reparto dell'ospedale in cui è ricoverato, e come tale popolata anche da versioni alternative dei diversi pazienti. Così, un vecchio scorbutico è raffigurato come un irascibile orso, un tale affetto da demenza è un essere acquatico un po' svanito, e via dicendo.

Per fare luce sulle questioni irrisolte dei pazienti e scoprire di cos'hanno bisogno per essere in pace, il bambino e la sua mamma dovranno così andare avanti e indietro tra i due mondi, risolvendo piccoli ma intelligenti puzzle logici e ambientali (più nella prima metà del gioco, la seconda è più dialogata e con poca interazione) tra sequenze oniriche che affondano le radici nel passato della persona in questione. 

Il gameplay è sostanzialmente questo, si va in giro a parlare con la gente, si completano le varie sidequest di ogni personaggio, si raccolgono e si usano diversi oggetti, si costruiscono attrezzi (come il piccone) per accedere a nuove aree della Foresta e si interagisce con uno dei due mondi per creare delle ripercussioni nell'altro. 
Ci sono giusto un paio di sequenze più trial&error, ma anche se si "muore" c'è sempre un comodo salvataggio automatico pochi secondi prima, ed è comunque possibile salvare quando si vuole.

I controlli predefiniti (e indicati a schermo) sono invece quelli della tastiera, ma il pad 360 funziona ugualmente seppur con una configurazione un po' strana (X per confermare, B per il menu… ovviabile con programmi esterni se proprio si vuole, o anche no). 

Il sottotesto del gioco, ovvero la vicenda che fa idealmente da sfondo al ricovero di molti pazienti e alla situazione drammatica in cui si trova l'ospedale, non viene mai chiaramente esplicitata, ma è facilmente intuibile leggendo i (molti) interessanti documenti e ritagli di giornale sparsi in giro, utili anche per farsi un quadro più chiaro della storia delle diverse persone.

E non crediate che dopo l'esperienza con TTM la Shigihara ci sia andata più leggera, anzi: ognuno dei pazienti -protagonista incluso- è estremamente ben caratterizzato, e i drammi che li vedono protagonisti (che non spoilero) sono resi in maniera molto credibile anche dall'ottimo lavoro di sceneggiatura che c'è dietro - preciso che il gioco per ora è solo in un inglese abbastanza semplice, ma questo non impedisce agli occhi di inumidirsi in più di un'occasione, con un paio di pugnalate notevoli.

Senza grandi sorprese, pure il comparto audio è eccellente e passa con scioltezza da brani molto allegri e orecchiabili come quello del villaggio dei Leeble a brevi canzoni (cantate da Laura e da altri) con le quali culminano le varie vicende dei pazienti. 

Anche la durata supera quella di TTM, attestandosi su buone 7-8 ore per completare la storia principale prendendosela comoda nel risolvere gli enigmi e chiacchierando un po' con tutti, mamma compresa, dopo ogni evento maggiore per vedere cos'hanno di nuovo da dire, e provando a completare anche un paio di quest facoltative.

Se le struggenti vicende di To The Moon non vi sono bastate e ne volete ancora, Rakuen con la sua leggerezza solo apparente fa senz'altro per voi. Più elaborato sia come gameplay che come mole di dialoghi, è una sorta di TTM³ e la dimostrazione di come con RPG-Maker si possano ancora creare delle ottime cose se si ha una solida base dietro e la voglia di raccontare una storia che tocchi i cuori dei giocatori.

To the Moon is one of my favorite games of all time. This game was definitely inspired by it, so picking it up during the latest sale was a no brainer for me. Just finished it today. So here's some thoughts (no spoilers):

- It feels more like a game and less like an experience than TtM. There is much more to collect and do here. Also, it tells quite a few interwoven story arcs, as opposed to TtM's one.
- Therefore this game is much longer. Which is both a good thing and a bad thing. The good: More bang for your buck, and more chances for one of its arcs to emotionally bend you over the proverbial barrel (which, let's be honest, that's what we're all here for, right?). The bad: Some of it's arcs were emotional misses for me, and so felt disappointing.
- The humor isn't always present, but when it is, it is on point, which adds much needed levity. This game gets heavy. To describe it in the words of a great man, "Sad."
- I was quite satisfied by the experience. It never actually got me to cry (TtM got me, twice, by comparison), but I did have my throat catch a couple times, along with some whispered "Oh no"s (let me read that letter next to the marbles, dang it!) and so would very much recommend it.
